bnf.Tree

    • Uses of Tree in bnf

      Methods in bnf that return Tree 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Tree<V> Tree.getChild(int index)
      Gets the child tree object located at the given index.
      Tree<Token> BNF.lookUp(java.lang.String nonterminal)
      Looks up a rule by its nonterminal key and returns the Tree containing the rule's definition.
      static Tree<java.lang.String> Tree.parse(java.lang.String treeDescription)
      Parses a String describing a tree into a Tree object.
      Methods in bnf that return types with arguments of type Tree 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.util.Iterator<Tree<V>> Tree.iterator()
      Returns the iterator object for a tree's children.
      Methods in bnf with parameters of type Tree 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void Tree.addChild(int index, Tree<V> child)
      Adds a single child tree to the tree at the given index.
      void Tree.addChildren(Tree<V>... children)
      Adds one or more child trees to the tree in l-to-r order to the right of any existing children.
      static java.util.List<java.lang.String> ProgramGenerator.expandTree(Tree<Token> tree)
      Helper method for expand.
